title: How to Make a Natural Cleaner

steps.headline: Mix the cleaner ingredients in a large, clean bucket.
steps.description: Pour 1/2 gallon (2 l) of water into your bucket. Add 1/2 cup (118 ml) of white, distilled vinegar into the bucket. Add 1/4 cup (51.5 g) of baking soda and mix well. You can substitute the baking soda with 2 tsp. of borax, otherwise known as sodium borate. Borax is a crystallized boron compound that is often used in detergents and has anti-fungal properties.

steps.headline: Use a funnel to pour the cleaning solution into spray bottles or a large plastic bottle for storage.
steps.description: All-purpose cleaners can be used to clean kitchen counters, water deposit stains, chrome fixtures, mirrors, floors, bathtubs and more. For a stronger all-purpose cleaner, add 1/4 tsp. (1.23 ml) of liquid Castile soap, which is an olive-oil based soap made in Spain.

text: Natural All-Purpose Cleaner Mix the cleaner ingredients in a large, clean bucket. Pour 1/2 gallon (2 l) of water into your bucket. Add 1/2 cup (118 ml) of white, distilled vinegar into the bucket. Add 1/4 cup (51.5 g) of baking soda and mix well. You can substitute the baking soda with 2 tsp. of borax, otherwise known as sodium borate. Borax is a crystallized boron compound that is often used in detergents and has anti-fungal properties. Use a funnel to pour the cleaning solution into spray bottles or a large plastic bottle for storage. All-purpose cleaners can be used to clean kitchen counters, water deposit stains, chrome fixtures, mirrors, floors, bathtubs and more. For a stronger all-purpose cleaner, add 1/4 tsp. (1.23 ml) of liquid Castile soap, which is an olive-oil based soap made in Spain. Natural Oven Cleaner Combine 1/2 cup (120.7 g) of salt, 1/4 cup (57.5 g) of borax and 16 oz. (453.6 g) of baking soda in a bowl or bucket. Slowly add enough water to make a paste, approximately 1 cup (236.6 ml).  Remove the racks on your oven and turn the temperature up to 250 degrees Fahrenheit (121 degrees Celsius).  Turn off the oven after it has pre-heated. Cleaning should start while the oven is still hot, so wear an oven mitt to apply the cleanser to avoid being burned. Dip a sponge in the paste and spread it on all over the oven's surfaces. Spray the walls of your oven with the all-purpose cleaner you just made.  Allow the mixture to sit on the oven's surfaces for 30 minutes. Set a timer so that you remember to return. Scrub with a sponge and steel wool to loosen caked-on oven stains.  Rinse with water and open the doors to allow the oven to dry before using.  Natural Glass Cleaner Pour 1 cup (236.6 ml) of water into an empty, clean spray bottle.  Add 1 cup (236.6 ml) of common rubbing alcohol. This is also called isopropyl alcohol and it is sold in most pharmacies and supermarkets. Add 1 tbsp. of white vinegar and shake thoroughly. Spray the mixture on the surface of glass and wipe clean with a paper towel or kitchen towel.
